page.title: 13FARMING
page.content: Most farms in this area graze cows and sheep. There are dairy cows and beef cattle. Many farms cut the grass to make silage, which is used as fodder during the winter months. Newhall Farm does grow potatoes, wheat and barley, but not in large amounts. Church Farm, Whitley is a dairy farm with 50 cows. They are all of the old dairy longhorn breed. Milking takes place at 6.30 am and 5.00 pm in an automatic herringbone milking parlour, which milks 10 cows at a time; the whole process for 50 cows takes 1 hr. The milk is kept in a refrigerated tank until collected. The farm has 2 Jacobs sheep providing wool for the family which is spun and knitted by the farmer's wife. The farm has 100 acres of grassland.
